Method Detail

getContents

public static java.lang.String getContents(java.lang.String path)
Gets the full string contents of a file and returns them. Returns null if there is an IOException, or if the file is empty.

Parameters:
path - The file to extract the contents from.
Returns:
The contents of the file as a string, or null if the file is empty.

getContents

public static java.lang.String getContents(java.io.File f)
Gets the full string contents of a file and returns them. Returns null if there is an IOException, or if the file is empty.

Parameters:
f - The file to extract the contents from.
Returns:
The contents of the file as a string, or null if the file is empty.

getLineCount

public static int getLineCount(java.lang.String path)
Counts the number of lines in a text file. Returns -1 if the file is empty, or if there are any errors encountered.

Parameters:
path - The file to retrieve the line count for.
Returns:
an integer representation of the line count, 0 if the file is empty.

readLine

public static java.lang.String readLine(java.lang.String path,
                                        int lineNumber)
Reads a specific line from a file. Line numbering begins at 1. Entering a line number less than or equal to zero will return an empty string. If there aren't enough lines in the file, an empty string will be returned. If any errors are encountered, null will be returned.

Parameters:
path - The file to read.
lineNumber - The line number to read in the file.
Returns:
The specified line from the file as a string.

isEmpty

public static boolean isEmpty(java.lang.String path)
Tests to see if a file is empty.

Parameters:
path -
Returns:
true if file is empty, else false.
